line_1: The taper burnt clear, yet no leaf would consume,
line_2: It just warm'd the buds, and increas'd their perfume,

line_1: And, that your Time I mayn't consume,
line_2: View him in the New Coffee-Room!

line_1: And, Wher's thy Starry Seat should they consume?
line_2: And loe the Mighty Poles begin to fume;
Till the wan maid, whose early bloom

line_1: Fire the wet wood, the sacred bull consume;
line_2: — Descending flames the dusky shrine illume;

line_1: "Let Grief no more thy youth consume,
line_2: " Nor sighing o'er the silent tomb

line_1: Dost thou thy useless Time consume,
